title:
Quantum aspects of non-invertible flavor symmetries in
  intersecting/magnetized D-brane models
authors: Shuta Funakoshi, Tatsuo Kobayashi, Hajime Otsuka
abstract:
We discuss selection rules of chiral matters in type IIA intersecting and IIB
magnetized D-brane models on toroidal orbifolds. Since the chiral matters on
toroidal orbifolds are labeled by a certain conjugacy class of the gauged
orbifold group, the selection rules involve non-trivial fusion rules. We find
that the representation of the chiral matters is described by a $D_4$ flavor
symmetry for an even number of magnetic fluxes or winding numbers at tree
level. Furthermore, the $D_4$ symmetry still remains even when we take into
account loop effects. We also study non-perturbative effects such as D-brane
instantons.
